item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Suggested text: Our website address is: https://plus.dacdbdev.com.

Comments

Suggested text: When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

Suggested text: If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Cookies

Suggested text: If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Suggested text: Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Who we share your data with

Suggested text: If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

How long we retain your data

Suggested text: If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

Suggested text: If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where your data is sent

Suggested text: Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

item.title: Installation
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Using WordPress:

  • Log in to your WordPress admin dashboard.
  • Go to "Plugins" and click on "Add New".
  • Click on "Upload Plugin" and choose the downloaded plugin file (.zip format) from your computer.
  • Click "Install Now" and wait for the installation to complete.

Manual Installation:

Alternatively, you can install the plugin via FTP:

  • Log in to your website's FTP account using an FTP client (e.g., FileZilla).
  • Access your website's root directory.
  • Navigate to the "wp-content/plugins" folder.
  • Extract the downloaded plugin file (.zip format) on your computer.
  • Upload the extracted plugin folder to the "wp-content/plugins" directory on your website using FTP.
  • Once uploaded, go to your WordPress admin dashboard.
  • Go to "Plugins" and locate the newly uploaded plugin.

Final Steps:

  1. Click "Activate" to activate the plugin.
  2. Update the plugin settings:
    • Click Settings under the plugin name on the Installed Plugins page.
    • In the Admin Dashboard menu, click Settings then DACdb.
  3. Enter your Account or District number.
  4. Enter your Club/Chapter/Region number. If you are managing a district-level website, set this to 0.
  5. Select your system:
    • Rotary: Choose DACdb (This is the default).
    • All others: Choose iMembersDB.
  6. Adjust other settings as needed to customize the display of data on your website.

IMPORTANT: If you intend to display maps on your website, you need to add a Google Maps API key to your settings.

That's it! DACdb Plus is now installed and active on your website!

item.title: Shortcodes
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
DACdb Plus is a robust WordPress plugin, giving clubs and districts the ability to display lots of DACdb content on their WordPress website.

How to Display Your Data

To display data from DACdb on your website, you must add small blocks of text called “shortcodes” to fields in the WordPress editor. To begin, we’ll create a test page to experiment with shortcodes.

  1. From the WordPress Dashboard, click “Pages” from the left-hand columns.
  2. Click the “Add New” button at the top of the page next to “Pages.”
  3. Click on “Add Title” and type, Club Information then press enter.
  4. Press the / key on your keyboard, then click “[/] Shortcode” from the dropdown list.
  5. Click inside the field that says, "Write shortcode here…” and type (or copy and paste) this whole block:
    [[dacdb_plus show="show-code"]]
  6. Replace "show-code" with one of the shortcode names from the table below.
  7. Click the “UPDATE” button in the top right-hand corner.
  8. In the bottom-left corner, you’ll see a confirmation that says, “Page updated.” Click the “View Page” link next to that to view your page.

Supported Content

Name Show Code Shortcode Notes
Areas areas [[dacdb_plus show="areas"]] Districts only.
Birthdays birthdays [[dacdb_plus show="birthdays"]]
Calendar calendar [[dacdb_plus show="calendar"]]
Club Leaders clubleaders [[dacdb_plus show="clubleaders"]] Clubs only.
Club Leaders (json output) JSONclubleaders [[dacdb_plus show="JSONclubleaders"]]
Club Meetings club_meetings [[dacdb_plus show="club_meetings"]] Clubs only.
Club Presidents club_presidents [[dacdb_plus show="club_presidents"]] Districts only.
Council of Governors cog [[dacdb_plus show="cog"]] Districts only.
Committee committee [[dacdb_plus show="committee"]]
Committee Leaders committee_leaders [[dacdb_plus show="committee_leaders"]]
Committees committees [[dacdb_plus show="committees"]]
District Committee Chairs dcc [[dacdb_plus show="dcc"]] Districts only.
District Leaders d_leaders [[dacdb_plus show="d_leaders"]] Districts only.
Documents documents [[dacdb_plus show="documents"]]
Events events [[dacdb_plus show="events"]]
Leaders leaders [[dacdb_plus show="leaders"]] Clubs only.
Map map [[dacdb_plus show="map"]] Districts only. You will need to enter a Google Maps API Key on the settings dashboard in order to render a map.
Meeting Info meeting_info [[dacdb_plus show="meeting_info"]]
Members members [[dacdb_plus show="members"]] Clubs only.
Newsletter newsletter [[dacdb_plus show="newsletter"]]
Speakers speakers [[dacdb_plus show="speakers"]]
Sponsors sponsors [[dacdb_plus show="sponsors"]]
Stories stories [[dacdb_plus show="stories"]]
Where Clubs Meet wcm [[dacdb_plus show="wcm"]] Districts only.

item.title: DACdbPlus WordPress Plugin
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Welcome to DACdb Plus! We are excited to introduce you to this powerful tool designed exclusively for members of DACdb and iMembersDB. Whether you are managing a district or club, this plugin will streamline your operations and enhance your online presence.

What is DACdb Plus?

DACdb Plus is a WordPress Plugin specifically developed to seamlessly integrate DACdb and iMembersDB with your WordPress website. This plugin offers a wide range of features and functionalities to simplify management tasks and improve communication with your members.

Key Features and Benefits

  • Efficient Management: DACdb Plus provides you with a centralized platform within your WordPress dashboard to efficiently manage user profiles, events, committees, and more. Say goodbye to juggling multiple platforms and enjoy the convenience of having all your management tasks in one place.
  • Enhanced Communication: Stay connected with your community using the robust communication features of DACdb Plus. Send newsletters, event reminders, and important announcements to keep your members engaged and informed.
  • Seamless Integration: DACdb Plus seamlessly integrates with your existing website and DACdb or iMembersDB database. This integration ensures smooth data synchronization between platforms, minimizing disruptions to your operations.
  • Customization and Flexibility: Customize the look and feel of your website with DACdb Plus. The plugin offers customizable templates and flexible settings, allowing you to tailor your website to match your organization's branding and style.

Get Started with DACdb Plus

We encourage you to download and install DACdb Plus today. Visit the WordPress plugin repository, search for DACdb Plus, and click the "Install Now" button. Once activated, you can start harnessing the full potential of this plugin to streamline your management processes.

Contribute to Our Online Community

Join our online community of DACdb Plus users and actively contribute to the growth and improvement of the plugin. Share your experiences, suggestions, and insights to help us enhance DACdb Plus further. Your feedback will play a vital role in shaping the plugin's future development.

Explore Documentation and Examples

To make your experience with DACdb Plus even more seamless, we provide comprehensive documentation and examples. Explore our detailed guides, tutorials, and real-life use cases to familiarize yourself with the plugin's features and unlock its full potential. Our documentation ensures you have all the information you need to

item.title: Committee
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
District and club committee information, sorted alphabetically by committee. Committe ID is required, as can be found in DACdb on the committee listing page. It is passed in as a parameter in the shortcode as shown:

[dacdb_plus show="committee" cid="123"]

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Districts only. Displays a map showing the meeting location of all clubs in the district. You will need to enter a Google Maps API Key on the settings dashboard in order to render a map.

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard. Commenter avatars come from Gravatar.

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Where Clubs Meet
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
District only: An alphabetical list of club names, links to the club’s website (if available), area number, and weekly meeting information.
